lom:description.lom:string: Science News, July 3. 2008. Excerpt: "Scientists using data from NASA's Voyager 2 spacecraft have observed the bubble of solar wind surrounding the solar system is not round, but has a squashed shape, according to recent data published as part of a series of papers in Nature the week of July 3." Image caption: This artist's rendering depicts NASAs Voyager 2 spacecraft as it studies the outer limits of the heliosphere - a magnetic 'bubble' around the solar system that is created by the solar wind. Scientists observed the magnetic bubble is not spherical, but pressed inward in the southern hemisphere, according to recent data published as part of a series of papers in this week's (July 3, 2008) Nature. These findings help build up a picture of how the sun interacts with the surrounding interstellar medium. (Credit: Image courtesy of NASA/Jet Propulsion Laboratory)

lom:keyword.lom:string: Voyager 1, solar system, heliosheath, termination shock, Voyager 2

lom:title.lom:string: Voyager Squashes View Of Solar System
